thesis: Mandate constraint: rebalance due today = false (weekly cadence; minimum spacing 7 days), so portfolio must remain unchanged.
Data integrity constraint: tool could not verify latest prices/1-day moves for holdings or SPY/QQQ today; without verified inputs we avoid any action framed as momentum/relative-strength driven.

Variant view: the edge here is rule-discipline—avoid unverified signal-chasing; defer momentum/quality re-score to next eligible rebalance window when weekly 30/90d histories and ratios/news can be validated.
risks: Macro: if an equity index shock occurs before the next rebalance window, the growth sleeve could draw down; hedge efficacy is UNKNOWN without today’s verified pricing.
Idiosyncratic: single-name downside (earnings/guidance, regulatory, product cycles) could impair one or more concentrated holdings; no tool-verified news was pulled today (non-rebalance day).
Execution/liquidity: none today (no trades); risk is opportunity cost if a genuine regime shift occurred today that we cannot verify with tool data.
falsifiable_checks: Next eligible rebalance run: require tool-verified WEEKLY 30d/90d history for each holding plus SPY/QQQ; if any critical fields remain UNKNOWN, reduce confidence and limit changes to highest-conviction replacements only.

Next eligible rebalance run: if V shows negative 30d and 90d weekly returns AND lags both SPY and QQQ on weekly closes, prioritize a replacement candidate within the 3-change cap (unless thesis damage is severe).
trade_of_the_day.why_now: Base: rules-based hold to minimize turnover drag when rebalance is not due; Bull: today’s data outage prevents false positives and preserves optionality for a cleaner, tool-verified rebalance; Bear: if a sharp regime break happened today, we may be late by up to the cadence window—accepted tradeoff under the mandate and current data integrity.
